ygData.subject: Cantera 1.2 for Windows
ygData.msgSnippet: Cantera 1.2 is now available for Windows PCs. To build it, you need both Visual C++ 6.0 and Visual Fortran 6.0. A Fortran-only version that doesn t require C++

Subject: Cantera 1.2 for Windows

X-Yahoo-Profile: dggoodwin

Cantera 1.2 is now available for Windows PCs. To build it, you need 
both Visual C++ 6.0 and Visual Fortran 6.0. A Fortran-only version 
that doesn't require C++ will be posted later this morning.

It can be downloaded from http://blue.caltech.edu/cantera-1.2-r1.zip.
Unzip the file, and read file License.txt for information on the 
license terms. You implicitly agree to these terms if you use Cantera.

Then go to the win32 directory. Open workspace file cantera.dsw, and 
build everything.

Set environment variable CANTERA_ROOT to the top cantera directory 
(cantera-1.2). Under WinNT Or Win2000, do this by right-clicking 
on "My Computer" and selecting "Properties."


Projects 'zero' and 'testit' build executables that should run 
without modification. 'zero' is a zero-dimensional kinetics 
simulator, and 'testit' can run any of the examples in the manual.


To build your own Fortran Cantera application:
1) make a new project
2) add your files
3) specify that it depends on projects 'ctf' and 'fortran90'
4) open the 'settings' panel, and under 'Fortran' specify the 
multithreaded DLL library, and that module files are in 
directory 'lib'.


Let me know if you have any problems, sugestions, etc.


btw - 'cstr_t' in the manual has been replaced by 'reactor_t'
